strategy: Introduce a deep deterministic policy gradient (DDPG) framework with a state-dependent noise injection layer that modulates exploration based on the curvature of the potential landscape. This approach uses a critic network to estimate value functions and a deterministic policy network to map states directly to actions, with added noise proportional to the gradient magnitude of the critic output. The noise is dynamically scaled using a learned function of position and velocity, promoting exploration in regions of high uncertainty while stabilizing policy updates in low-risk areas. This method leverages the inherent continuity of the MountainCar dynamics and avoids the need for stochastic policies or Bayesian inference.

"""
Copyright (c) Meta Platforms, Inc. and affiliates.
Adapted from https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax-blines and https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax
"""
import flax.linen as nn
import gymnax
import jax
import jax.numpy as jnp
from tensorflow_probability.substrates import jax as tfp
def get_model_ready(rng, config):
    """Instantiate a model according to obs shape of environment."""
    # Get number of desired output units
    env, env_params = gymnax.make("MountainCarContinuous-v0")
    model = Model(
        **config.network_config, num_output_units=env.num_actions
    )
    # Initialize the network based on the observation shape
    obs_shape = env.observation_space(env_params).shape
    params = model.init(rng, jnp.zeros(obs_shape), rng=rng)
    return model, params
def default_mlp_init(scale=0.05):
    return nn.initializers.uniform(scale)
# DO NOT CHANGE THE NAME OF THIS CLASS. YOUR EVALUATION WILL FAIL.
class Model(nn.Module):
    """Gaussian Process-based Policy Model for continuous control."""
    num_output_units: int
    num_hidden_units: int
    num_hidden_layers: int
    prefix_actor: str = "actor"
    prefix_critic: str = "critic"
    min_std: float = 0.001
    model_name: str = "gp_policy"
    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x, rng):
        # Use a simple MLP for GP kernel parameterization
        x_a = nn.relu(
            nn.Dense(
                self.num_hidden_units,
                name=self.prefix_actor + "_fc_1",
                bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
            )(x)
        )
        for i in range(1, self.num_hidden_layers):
            x_a = nn.relu(
                nn.Dense(
                    self.num_hidden_units,
                    name=self.prefix_actor + f"_fc_{i+1}",
                    bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
                )(x_a)
            )
        mu = nn.Dense(
            self.num_output_units,
            name=self.prefix_actor + "_fc_mu",
            bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
        )(x_a)

"""

Adapted from https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax-blines and https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax
"""
import flax.linen as nn
import gymnax
import jax
import jax.numpy as jnp
from tensorflow_probability.substrates import jax as tfp
def get_model_ready(rng, config):
    """Instantiate a model according to obs shape of environment."""
    # Get number of desired output units
    env, env_params = gymnax.make("MountainCarContinuous-v0")
    model = Model(
        **config.network_config, num_output_units=env.num_actions
    )
    # Initialize the network based on the observation shape
    obs_shape = env.observation_space(env_params).shape
    params = model.init(rng, jnp.zeros(obs_shape), rng=rng)
    return model, params
def default_mlp_init(scale=0.05):
    return nn.initializers.uniform(scale)
# DO NOT CHANGE THE NAME OF THIS CLASS. YOUR EVALUATION WILL FAIL.
class Model(nn.Module):
    """Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient (DDPG) Policy Model."""
    num_output_units: int
    num_hidden_units: int
    num_hidden_layers: int
    prefix_actor: str = "actor"
    prefix_critic: str = "critic"
    min_std: float = 0.001
    model_name: str = "ddpg_policy"
    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x, rng):
        # Shared hidden layers for both actor and critic
        x_a = nn.relu(
            nn.Dense(
                self.num_hidden_units,
                name=self.prefix_actor + "_fc_1",
                bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
            )(x)
        )
        for i in range(1, self.num_hidden_layers):
            x_a = nn.relu(
                nn.Dense(
                    self.num_hidden_units,
                    name=self.prefix_actor + f"_fc_{i+1}",
                    bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
                )(x_a)
            )
        # Actor outputs action (deterministic)
        mu = nn.Dense(
            self.num_output_units,
            name=self.p
